p: Carbohydrates, including mono-, oligo-, and polysaccharides, have both structural and metabolic functions. Carbohydrates can be found attached to proteins or lipids (e.g., glycoproteins and glycolipids), and complex polysaccharides compose the major structural features of the cell wall [ 63]. In addition, microalgae make glucose and starch-like energy storage products, which are the primary carbon-containing products from photosynthesis [ 57].
